Reviews.Title: “Ample breakfast, excellent service, clean and safe”
Reviews.Author: Konstantinos P
Reviews.Content: Four friends we visited London 10 days ago and stayed for 5 days in a four-bedded room at the Continental hotel which was recommended by friends. When we made the booking we asked the receptionist the cheapest way to the hotel from Heathrow by train, he advised us to take the Heathrow connect to Paddington. The hotel is just around the corner from paddington station, it is a lovely place opposite a small park. The room was spacious with high ceilings, clean with comfortable new beds. Although is a budget hotel it has 24 hours security and reception. The breakfast is ample continental with very tasty cornflakes to start, toasts, butter, marmalade, tea, coffee as much as we wanted of everything. That was really good as we didn't feel hungry until late afternoon. The staff are friendly and very helpful, when asked they told us where to buy good quality things the cheapest way - we really appreciated this. The location is excellent everything is within walking distance. We recommend it as a clean, quiet, safe hotel to stay.

Reviews.Title: “rat trap”
Reviews.Author: joe t
Reviews.Content: i am a contractor who frequently stays in budget hotels in the london area and over the last 10 yrs i think i have seen the best and the worst of of a massive band of similarly priced accommodation . then i found the continental at paddington . this hotel is advertised daily in the london metro and as i was working in the area i decided to book over the phone and took a twin room at the advertised rate , myself and a workmate checked in and were given a room with shared bathroom near reception . first thing i saw as i opened the door was a gaping hole in the wall by the window , moving the curtains aside to take a closer look i was genuinely taken aback at the dust and dirt on the sills and curtains . the blankets on the bed were ancient and looked as though they had been shredded by some feral beast , maybe they had as there was a rodent trap concealed between one of the beds and the crumbling wall . we walked straight out and asked for our money back as a rat trap in the room is surely good reason . a slimy character on reception at first refused us a refund as we had used the room , in fact we were in the room 5 mins at most , he relented after a lengthy exchange and we walked around the square and got a room in a much better establishment for a pound a night more . if you want to stay in this area and you have a little time i would advise to go door to door as we did - there are so many hotels in the area you will almost certainly find something to suit your standards and budget

Reviews.Title: “Good Service”
Reviews.Author: RebelRydr
Reviews.Content: Overall was an amazing experience. A good hotel to stay for a few days trip. Room service was excellent. The package includes breakfast as well and you can also ask for a takeaway if your getting late for your flight. Rooms are quite spacious and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “My visit to London stay in Paddington at The Continental Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Flavio R
Reviews.Content: I visited London with 3 friends of me. I find The Continental through me friends as not expensive hotel. We stay 7 days. We had a very good time in London and find new friends at The Continental from Korea. The Continental was very good price and very good central place with many bus and metro. The Continental was clean and staff were very good and help alot to find many place to go I like it alot and me friends same. Very beautiful garden outside bedroom window to see. When we come next we stay here and we tell our friends. I put pictures.

Reviews.Title: “nice rooms, clean and low prices”
Reviews.Author: Lydia M
Reviews.Content: I am going to start university soon so I went to London to look for a flat and while I was searching, I stayed at the continental hotel in a single room witth private shower and toilet after a friend recommended it as he stayed also there. It is clean, safe, warm and friendly place. The staff were very friendly and helpful. I will use it again and will reccommend it to other friends definately

Reviews.Title: “safe, clean and very good value”
Reviews.Author: Ioannis G
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the continental with my wife and another couple in August after it was recommended by friends. It is nice hotel, clean, quiet, in a leafy square and most important safe. The prices are really low, almost half the prices of other hotels in the area as we asked few hotels on our way to the continental to compare. We liked this hotel very much and we will be back and recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “We recommend it”
Reviews.Author: Maria D
Reviews.Content: My husband and myself visited London in September for few days. We stayed at the continental hotel after a friend recommended it to us. The location is very good and everything is within walking distance, like oxford street, Marble Arch and Hyde Park. We liked the hotel, the room was facing the square, it was quiet and clean and the staff was helpful. We recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Clean cheap pleasant position excellent!”
Reviews.Author: mark d
Reviews.Content: I visited London with my partner from Friday 2nd of September for 5 nights, my partner booked a hotel in Norfolk square Paddington but when we arrived the hotel said there was no booking for us and offend us a very small room in the basement at the back with the window in a light-well. We did not except that room so we left the hotel and walked in the square and saw that the only hotel with 5 star hygiene on the door was the Continental hotel, We asked for a double room with a view of the garden. A very polite receptionist said they only had a triple room left at Â£79 instead of Â£59 that they sell the doubles, still it was much cheaper then the previous hotel and the other two we visited. We asked to see the room which was on the 1st floor with a lovely view, we found the room big clean and with lots of light and the beds comfortable so we paid for it, the price included continental breakfast and VAT. The reception was open 24hours and the staff was pleasant, polite and helpful the breakfast room was spotless the position of the hotel in Central London excellent. we recommend it. I am attaching pictures. Mark.

Reviews.Title: “I loved it and I' ll be back”
Reviews.Author: Iordanis K
Reviews.Content: Friends who stayed in this hotel recommended it to me as it is clean, friendly and excellent value for money. I stayed in a single en-suite for a week as I was looking for a flat to share with other friends before the universities start in September. The room was clean and generally the hotel was clean and the staff were helpful. I have recommended already to family and other friends, and I will use it again in September before the contract for the flat begins.

Reviews.Title: “Half the price!”
Reviews.Author: Leslie B
Reviews.Content: Was with the husband and are daughter in a family room can't beat the value for money, it was half the price of the hotels in the area! And they even gave us a light breakfast. Clean Friendly and good value for money. The room was facing a lovely garden and we used to sit and have are lunch most afternoons. We are back in London for Christmas so will differently stay again!

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: Andy C
Reviews.Content: I was visiting relatives with my wife and children in west London and stayed in this hotel for 8 nights. The location is excellent, everything is within walking distance, the prices unbeatable, the rooms were very clean and the staff were friendly. The price also included breakfast which was continental. The reception was open 24 hours. We do recommend this hotel and we will definetely come back.

Reviews.Title: “unbeatable value”
Reviews.Author: Tyler G
Reviews.Content: The dad of my friend Jason told me to stay at The Continental Hotel in Paddington when I visited London last week. We had a Double room for Â£59 which i couldn't believe as i thought it would be much higher to include a shower, toilet, sink, TV and the breakfast was included too. Everthing was clean and cheerful. the position was ideal. I will be going back

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: Sophia T
Reviews.Content: We visited London in July. We were eight friends from university and stayed for 10 days in two quadrooms with private shower and toilet. We had really nice time there. The hotel is clean and the staff were friendly. The prices were the cheapest one in that area after we checked the other hotels nearby for prices. We will go back again to this hotel in our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “we will be back”
Reviews.Author: chryssa p
Reviews.Content: 12 friends from university stayed in this hotel for 6 nights in 3 rooms with shower and toilet. The rooms were clean with high ceilings,the reception was 24 hours open. We asked for places to go for shopping and the staff were very helpful and gave us directions. our stay in this hotel was pleasant and we will book again

Reviews.Title: “friendly and clean”
Reviews.Author: Marilena A
Reviews.Content: We were at St. Mary's Hospital for treatment and were looking for a hotel, they recommended us the continental as they said many people who accompany patients stay there and were very happy, so we booked there. It is just around the corner from the hospital, the room was clean, the staff were friendly and very helpful - we were pleased that we discovered this hotel and we will recommend it to friends and others and we'll definetely book again hopefully this time for leisure.

Reviews.Title: “clean, friendly, good value and great location”
Reviews.Author: ASPA K
Reviews.Content: A friend who lives in London booked us in this hotel because it was the cheapest in this area. We had two triple rooms with private shower and toilet, we paid 79 pounds per room per night and this price also included breakfast. The first thing we checked when we went in the room was the beds if they were comfortable - they were new and comfortable, the rooms were clean and the toilets spotless. we are very happy with the hotel and we will go back again and we'll recommend it to other people.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and clean”
Reviews.Author: Antonio F
Reviews.Content: We were in London the first week of July, we dscovered the continental after checking all hotels nearby for prices - it was the cheapest and so we booked there. We had three doubles, the rooms were clean, the staff friendly, reception 24 hours, everything is within walking distance like oxford street and Hyde park. What inpressed us was that when we went to take breakfast which was included in the price, we looked at the kitchen, it was spotless. We will certainly stay there in our next trip. We recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Close for shopping Spree”
Reviews.Author: Steven M
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my girlfriend for a few nights at this hotel at the beginning of August. I picked this hotel as my friend liked it when he stayed here in May. The hotel is a budget hotel and is very central. We went to Oxford Street and it only took us 15 minutes to walk via Hyde Park. The price was very good, the room was clean, the staff were nice helpful and the reception was open 24 hours.

Reviews.Title: “My flight was cancelled”
Reviews.Author: Peter R
Reviews.Content: My flight was cancelled and I got the train back to Paddington and stated looking for a B & B. I walked around the corner and found Norfolk Square I started going in the hotels 1 by 1 and they were very expensive. However I walked in to The Continental after seeing the prices on the window which were much cheaper than the other hotels. They showed me a room which I liked. The room was clean and the bed was comfortable. The prices included continental breakfast as well so I took the room. I had a good nightâ€™s sleep and left the next day for the airport. The receptionist told me to get the Heathrow connect and not the Heathrow express as the connect is much cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Run away for your health and safety and stay somewhere else!!”
Reviews.Author: Q8022
Reviews.Content: I stayed in what it calls itself the continental hotel located in 36-42 Norfolk Street in London near the Paddington train station. A friendly advise for all of you to please stay away from this failthy dump! Unfortunatly, due to a sudden change of plan as a result of this unforseen circumstances I had to stay in London for one night. After searching for a single room all over Central London I couldn't find a hotel that accept me for one night due to high season and because I guess it was a Saturday. I therefore was so tired and desperate that I ended up in this dump failthy hotel thinking that it would at least meet the minumum of my needs. Wrong! I was given a double room as this is the only room that they had and I had no problem for 59 Pounds. when I handed my credit card to the guy at the reception, he asked that around two pounds will be charged on my bill which I thought it was extreemly odd but I had no other choice. well he gave me the key and told me that my room was on the fourth floor. after climbing an infintive narrow scary stairs, I managed to find my room. when I opened the door I swear I wanted to cry. The carpet had stains all over, the room had a terrible smell that makes you want vomit. The sheets have holes and looked like some blood on them. the toilet is so dirty and unflush and smells really bad and full of smoke. I had to spray my cologn all over the room to endure the terrible smell and to run away from this room as soon as possible as this smell would probably inflict a terrible health hazards to me. after hours of exploring London I came really late to have few hours of sleep to check out from this nightmare. I had to sleep on my cloths and I woke up really early to run for my life. I took a quick shower in the weirdest toilet ever. Pay little extra and stay at the beautiful Rhodes hotel in the same area or the stylohotel. This is a big shame of this beautiful city to allow such establishment to operate which it depicts a terrible image of London. as a matter of a fact I've flown the world and stayed in different categories of hotels but I've never experienced such a terrible stay like the one I've witnessed with the Continental hotel so please for your health and safety avoid staying at this place even if you sleep in the street.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap & Cheerfull”
Reviews.Author: PRRox
Reviews.Content: Ok , it's not super clean, its not super trendy, And its not the Ritz.. But it was fit for purpose. and very cheap considering the Location Location Location My Friend and I just needed a cheap crash pad and this was it, 15 min from Oxford St, pretty handy for us. We had our own towels so this wasn't an issue and MacDonald's was close bye so like I said "Cheap & Cheerfull". Served it's purpose just fine.

Reviews.Title: “terrible”
Reviews.Author: ijabesh
Reviews.Content: Yes it's a cheap hotel. But the staffs there are rude and not friendly. I stayed there 2 night with my friend in winter. The heater inside the room are not working. We cannot sleep well because its too cold, the next day we complained and asked for refund, but the staff are rude and didn't give our money back. They gave us another heater for the night, but still cold, and lucky our friend from there lent us his heater. And the breakfast there, just only 2 toast with butter and yellow jam. And we need to pay GBP 2 for towel. No kettle also. I will never stay in this hotel ever again.

Reviews.Title: “An awful dump”
Reviews.Author: Opus1099
Reviews.Content: I had to stay at this hotel because all the others nearby were fully booked. The Continental advertises cheap rooms in the London Evening Standard, but when I rang up the cheap rooms were not available and the man who answered the phone at the hotel was rude to me and said they were fully booked. I then called in at the hotel, where I was offered a cheaper room - but still not as cheap as their adverts. The room itself was dreadful. The radiator didn't work so I could not regulate the temperature. The tiny television only had one channel. There were no towels in the bathroom, which was cramped and filthy. The hotel is very noisy and seems to be right next to a main train line as trains were thundering past all the time. Avoid this place at all costs. I told the man that was rude to me on the phone that I would be writing a review and he said go and do it. I sincerely hope he is reading this.

Reviews.Title: “Complete health and safety Hazard.”
Reviews.Author: orgasmicfun
Reviews.Content: 36-42 Norfolk Square, London W2 1RT is the location for an establishment calling itself the Continental Hotel. Don't even think about staying there. The hotel should be closed down by the health and food safety people. The place is filthy dirty with excrement encrusted toilets. The rooms are undecorated, the walls and carpets are filthy. water cascades from above (yes cascade not just drip) when the people above use the shower. Hot water is strictly rationed, extra charges are made for the loan of an extremly small hand towel. There is much evidence of shoddy unfinished building works everywhere. The breakfast is a joke prepared by obviously unqualified staff. How on earth they manage to cock up tea/coffee and toast (thats what the advertised breakfast is) is beyond me but they manage to regularly serve cold coffee and rock hard or pale toast, the concept of toasting bread is beyond their comprehension. The Staff on reception are pleasant enough spending all their time fending off complaints, The catering and cleaning staff have no understanding of either catering or cleaning and some of them become abusive to customers who have the courage to complain. Fire doors are regularly propped open ("because it is easier to work that way"). The place should be shut down it is a health and safety hazard and is creating a very bad impression of the UK for visitors arriving at Paddington station.

Reviews.Title: “A shame for London Olympics”
Reviews.Author: the_traveller0815
Reviews.Content: The room where I stayed was tiny: 2,2 x 2,2 meters. The carpets and walls are dirty and filthy. The light has to be switch on outside the room. The paint on the wall is dirty and there are holes in the wall. There is no chest board and the room is furnitured by an old TV, placed on an old broken piece of furniture, has bad reception and faulty action bottoms. The room heating is not working and the proprietor borrowed me an electrical heating fan. The bed is too small for tall people and the mattress is dangerous for people with a fragile back. There is a toilet and a tiny shower, with unfinished blank wood, all dirty, filthy and dangerously exposed with nails. I injured myself my first day, so be vaccinated against tetanus. Careful, nails are also on the old dirty carpets of the sleeping room, so never walk with bare feet. Anyway, you would not dare because it's too dirty. There is also a big hole on the floor of the WC with broken tiles where cold draft is coming blowing cold air continously into your room. Do not look at the curtains which haven't been washed since ages. The breakfast is joke: 4 half slices of cheap and chewing gum like toast, only 1 sort of jam, but you can choose between cheapish tea and worn out coffee. Eastern European staff, poorly dressed and clearly demotivated, serve the breakfeast. Continental Hotel in the Westend is the cheapest hotel in London I have been in, however the money is not worth its value. It's dirty, cold, with a permanent draft so that you easily risk to catch a cold. Even for one who has a tight budget, saving a few pounds for a dirty hole, risking your health by hurting yourself with rusty nails, eventually ending up with sepsis or a tough flu, is not worth the money you are saving. The whole standard of the hotel is unacceptable, below any level of acceptance with rooms comparable to a prison hole. In the poorest places of underdeveloped Bolivia, I had much better accommodation in small but clean rooms provided by poor locals than in posh London. Even in underdeveloped countries, the very existence of dirty holes like in the Continental Hotel in London would be closed down. A cheap pension in Spain offers at least impeccably clean rooms. I understood from an Irish visitor that Continental Hotel even advertised in Ireland. Do not be tricked into the low prices! The only positive thing I can say about this hotel is that the location is good. In spite of the cheap hotel fare (I payed 20 Â£ for a night), it's neglected, dirty and overpriced. It's a shame for London to allow these hotels to operate. The local London authorities should seriously consider to regulate the hotel market for the upcoming Olympics and close down some of these so-called hotels like the Continental in Norfolk square for the sake of the international reputation of London and to improve the bad image investors have about this place. In all: this hotel was the greatest nightmare and the worst hotel in my life, just the rats were missing (probably I had the chance not to see them). There were no CCTV cameras, so there are also great security concerns if you leave anything like fancy clothes in your room. Anyone can ask for your key. There are no efforts at all to maintain this place and the filth and dirt is just disgusting, so never bring your wife or girl-friend into this place. The whole place is a disregard for travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Beware!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: christina7774
Reviews.Content: Ended up staying here as we orignally booked a room at Norfolk hotel few doors away (could be a scam as ive noticed a few people have said the same). Entered the building to an awful smell that i cant even describe and a man walking around looking like he just left a mental home!!!!!!! As you walk up the stairs you get the smell of a sewage and in every corner of the hallway there are bags of rubbish!!!! We had a family room for 4 people, there were 4 beds, a tv (which didnt work). The carpet was not hoovered with tissue on the floor. The curtain rail was hanging off the wall and the net curtain half falling off and looked like it had NEVER been cleaned!!! The toilet and shower was brown and had limescale all over it, We moved the bed side cabinet to hold the toilet door closed to keep the smell of sewage out of the room. We even had to run over to mcdonalds to use there toilet as we didnt want to use the one in the room. After our nite out we returned to the hotel and slept in our clothes as didnt want to touch the bed sheets. Insted of using the pillows which had stains on we used our coats. We had a family room which supposed to be for 4 people but we couldnt even all stand up at the same time as it was so small. Overall it was a terrible experience and in future we will be booking into well known hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Sleep tight mind the bed bugs dont bite”
Reviews.Author: BLUEBOY36
Reviews.Content: had a nights stay in a place that calls it self continental. sorry its not me my son and my mate stayed over saturday night and at around mid night we havd quite a number of visitors being bed bugs told the guy on reception but no rooms so we had to stay in the room he did give us clean sheets and promised the maid would clean it in the morning ha so slept with the lights on and was up at 5am manager said next morning so sorry its an old building . am so sorry its a [--] ps its Â£70 a nite my advise is if you book here sleep in the car or on the streets.

Reviews.Title: “Appalling!”
Reviews.Author: veryunhappyEngland
Reviews.Content: We took this hotel only because our original hotel (Avon) decided to give away one of our rooms and tried to persuade us to share. We looked at one of our rooms and assumed that the other would be similar. How wrong can you be? The general appearance of the hotel was shabby, but clean. However, when we entered the second room late that evening (number 15, which was on the third floor) it was so tiny that the basin was in the room, leaving no space for either a wardrobe or a chest of drawers. The black and red carpet had more black than when it was made, the inside of the toilet was brown, the toilet seat was broken and the counterpane was covered in stains from top to bottom. When I went downstairs to complain, I was told that I should have looked earlier and offered No 17, which was on the fourth floor, but the receptionist could or would not tell me whether it was any bigger. "We've got 100 rooms. How do you expect me to know all of them!" was the helpful reply. Luckily, my son had been given a triple, so I slept in their room that night - I didn't fancy climbing four flights of stairs to find another pigsty. I was given a ground floor room the next day (different receptionist), which was at least clean. Don't hold out too much hope for the continental breakfast. It is toast and marmalade and either tea or coffee. However, I must point out that the breakfast room and what I could see of the kitchen were spotless and the girls there very pleasant. By the way, I have given this place one mark, but only because the form did not allow me to put none! The only saving grace was the price, but even that did not make up for the room and lack of service. The place needs gutting.

Reviews.Title: “Very bad! Stay away!”
Reviews.Author: Jennyna
Reviews.Content: this is a TERRIBLE place....not hotel!!! stay AWAY!!!!! it's old, DIRTY, SMELLY and unsafe. BAD and [--]! I'm disgusted (4 people from Italy)

Reviews.Title: “Really bad experience”
Reviews.Author: GvaTourist
Reviews.Content: I originally reserved a room at Warwick Residence in the same area but was transferred to this hotel when I arrived London (the hotel I reserved said that they had some problems with the room). I had no idea about this hotel and accepted to check in there. The room and the furniture (bed, chairs) were old. The balcony looking to the garden was also dirty with the curtain nearly fell from the rail.The cleaner didn't clean the room or changed the towel everyday. The last day there was a drunk English teenager came to the dining room and bullied Asian customers while no staffs cared to stop him. I think it was run by the Chinese. The hotel should be inspected by the officials to improve the standard of living there. It's pity that tourists won't know only by looking from internet. It should be kicked out of business if they refuse to improve the condition. Don't go there.

Reviews.Title: “A Real Pig Sty”
Reviews.Author: Harwood
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel after seeing their rooms advertised for Â£32 a night. But, if you pay by credit card they place a 4% handling charge on top of this. The first room that I was given was a real pig sty. The television was on a table next to the wash basin and I assumed that to wash you had to lean past this and try not to splash water on the television itself. The shower was operated by two taps, no mixer and the toilet was leaking all over the floor so I asked for another room. The door would not lock and this room was on the ground floor. They gave me a room with four beds in it and I thought okay but that night there was a fight in the adjoining bedroom that involved a lot of shouting and screaming and the following morning I checked out. I did not even bother to ask for a refund of the nights that I was not planning to stay, I was just glad to get out of the place.

HotelInfo.Name: The Continental Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 36-42 Norfolk Square, London W2 1RT, England
